column4: the underlying autohrization mechanism (sud) does not allow you to run this program. contact your system admin

are you usiong your user's password?

what driver are you talking about?
do -->  sudo modprobe -r b43 && sudo modprobe b43
if it is a laptop check that you have the wifi enabled via the keyboard combo ( Fn + 2 usually ) or any other button
